Reviews.Title: “Beachwalkin”
Reviews.Author: KatieF32
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a long weekend at the beach and I stayed in this hotel with my best friend. I loved the location of this place. Very friendly staff. Clean. Will stay here again!!! The staff was so helpful when I accidently spilled coffee all over the quilt on the bed and assured me that I was not the first to do this nor would I be the last. The only thing I did not like was the shower so so small that all you could do is stand there and turn in a circle. Other than that it was fine. The tv was great, air conditioner in the room worked well and we had a little fridge which we put our left over goodies from the night before in. I loved being able to walk a few steps to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, small and steps to the boardwalk/beach”
Reviews.Author: Trvlr313
Reviews.Content: Pretty much what I expected for the cost and location. I would stay here again if there were a bigger room. We spent most of our time at my family's timeshare rental and came back here at nights to walk the boardwalk and crash. This is all you need at the beach, nothing more. Generally, the room we stayed I was clean. Toiletries are minimal and so are the furnishings. Management isn't really visible regularly, but we never needed them.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay in room 12 (lobby on one side/community porch on other)”
Reviews.Author: LN87
Reviews.Content: I really, really wanted to like this place, but in the end I have to have privacy and I have to get a good night's sleep. Unfortunately, neither happened. First the good: I love the building. I love the location. I think the room was clean-tiny (no chairs, only bed to sit on), but serviceable for the price and location. Now the bad: We stayed in room 12 which is right next to the lobby. The door doesn't fit properly in the frame so there are gaps all around the door. This means you hear Every. Single. Thing that goes on in the lobby. All the people entering and leaving. Also, the lobby is the primary way for people to get to their rooms on the second floor so the entering and leaving is pretty non-stop. The door slams. The guests weren't being obnoxious or anything, it's just that between the ill-fitting door with gaps and no soundproofing, you can hear EVERYTHING. I'm assuming anyone on the other side of our door could clearly hear what we were doing,too. Ummm, creepy. Remember the owner's comments below about the microwave, coffeepot, umbrellas, etc being in the lobby? Well, it's true. I know this because I heard all the other guests getting stuff in the lobby. I heard them talking in the lobby. Making coffee (and smelling it--we don't drink coffee so this was obnoxious to me and woke both of us up). The beeping of the microwave every 30 seconds. The CONSTANT screen door opening and shutting. OMG! Horrible. This went on for all but a brief period during the night. It started back up again around 5:30 am. Incidentally, I'm not a particularly light sleeper not do I expect silence. But this was ridiculous. Also, when I went into the room (which consisted of a bed and wall-mounted tv, dresser--again, small but adequate). I noticed the wall directly across from the bed was almost entirely windows with wood blinds. Great, I thought. Indirect sunlight. So I open the blinds and that's when I realized that on the other side of the window is the porch with rockers! With lots of people rocking! Oh yeah, the early-risers really enjoyed watching the sunrise from that porch. I know because I heard them talking about it. Finally, and this is small, but significant. For some unknown reason, the owners put a tiny little ledge above the bed. I'm guessing it is supposed to be some type of decoration--def not a headboard. No padding or anything. The significant part: when you sit up in bed, it is at the absolute perfect height for you to hit your head. Trust me on this one. The bottom line is that the other rooms could be fine. Room 12 is not. I was stuck in a room with an unfitted, definitely NOT sound-proofed door that had a lobby/kitchen/meeting place directly on the other side of an ill-fitting door and a huge set of window that had a popular porch on the other. Finally, the bathroom shower is tiny--no tub and definitely only one person could fit in that thing. Again, adequate, but just thought I'd share. Would I stay here again? Possibly, but ONLY if I didn't stay in room 12. I also want to experience the large room and peace and quiet the other reviewers got to experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever... 2 years running!”
Reviews.Author: Spanky0779
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love the Beach Walk! My Fiance and I have stayed there for the last 2 years and do not have one complaint. The owners are courteous, caring, and always look forward to your return. I dont know about the guy that complained about the uncomfortable beds because I think they are way above average seeing as how they are Queen size mattresses without those 80's floral print bedspreads!! :) We have stayed in OC for the last 6 years and have finally found the place we will be staying every summer from now on. Not even a Hurricane will keep us away!!! Thank you Beach Walk for always being out second home.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: kewiggins2003
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean, large, comfortable, and all at a great price! You cant get a better location. Just a few steps from the beach. So glad we found this hotel! Loved sitting out on the porch in the morning with a cup of coffee... so relaxing. After a great day at the beach this is definately a place you can come home to away from the hustle and bustle of the boardwalk to relax and get a great nights sleep. The staff was super friendly and professional, I cant wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: MSKI12
Reviews.Content: Hidden gem in ocean city, classic old fashioned hotel service that the name brand chains cannot touch. I thoroughly enjoyed the room, it was very clean and welcoming. The location is right by the ramp to the boardwalk, so your not far off from everything. Night time was quiet too! No loud obnoxious kids getting wasted there! I highly recommend this place if the space is available.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Melanie W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just recently returned from a stay at the Beach Walk Hotel. While the hotel is older it is evident that the owner's have made every effort to keep the hotel as modern as possible. The most important aspect to me in staying in a hotel is cleanliness - and this hotel was VERY clean. The owner's are nice and very personable. I loved that they had beach chairs and umbrellas available to guests free of charge. We took advantage of these each day. The location is great too, just a short walk to the beach and the boardwalk! We certainly will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Returning Again!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Beach Walk Hotel last August and are preparing our return in just a few weeks. I have spoken with Danelle on the phone several times and she is very nice; personable and attentive. We arrived prior to check in time and were allowed to check in early since our room was ready. Our room was on the third floor and the stairs were not bad at all (and I have a bad knee). Our room was spacious, comfortable and CLEAN! That is the first thing I noticed from the moment we checked in. This is a big issue with my family when we travel and could not have been more pleased. The owners and staff make every effort to make your stay comfortable and it shows. I was worried that perhaps I would be awaken early in the morning by other guests or neighbors, but it was quiet enough to allow us to sleep in. The beds were comfortable. The location of this hotel is terrific; just a stone's throw to the boardwalk and beach. We had no issue with parking, the outdoor private showers are great and it was nice to be able to borrow a beach chair when we needed one. We had to alter our stay one day (the exchange student we were sponsoring was arriving earlier than anticipated) and Danelle graciously and quickly made the change needed. The Beach Walk Hotel is a great value and we won't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: fromScranton
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visiting the Beach Walk Hotel in early July 2012. The location was the best part. We loved being so close to the boardwalk, restaurants, bars, and of course, the beach !! The room was spacious enough for us; and although was your basic "bedroom, and bathroom" it was good enough for two people that didn't spend much time in the room. If we come back to the Beach Walk (for the price, you can't beat it !) we might request something a little bigger, but the overall Hotel and Room was clean, pleasant and just what we needed. Thanks to the owner for letting us borrow her beach chair, when my boyfriend's broke!

Reviews.Title: “Big, Big Mistake”
Reviews.Author: trvlbabe40
Reviews.Content: Obnixious drunken teens were everywhere not just in the hotel (although the manager seemed to have a hold on them)...suprised the police were not called. The room had no alarm clock, phone or hair dryer. No water pressure the shower. No fabric softner was used on the towels. The bed was so uncomfortable we slept horribly and the 2 flimsy pillows didnt help either. Also, be wary of the rickety wooden steps that must be climbed to check in and access your room!!! I would not recommend this "hotel" for famalies. This place is only good for drunken teens.

Reviews.Title: “good and clean”
Reviews.Author: loveinnonoc
Reviews.Content: When ever I want to take my grandson to the ocean I go stay with Danielle and Mike. They are good, decent people. I can call her anytime and usually get just what I ask for. This year I got two bedrooms and my grandson thought he was so cool with his own room right off of mine. They do their best to keep things quiet and family friendly. The rooms are clean equiped with ever basic need. Thanks to the Amos family for a nice clean place.

Reviews.Title: “Like a B&B with no Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: daklmason
Reviews.Content: The Beach Walk is just like a Bed and Breakfast without the breakfast. This is not a hotel - no ice machines anyplace - we asked the owner for an ice cube tray for our refrigerator - they had none and didn't seem to care. The room was small - just the bare essentials - it was clean. The location is excellent - just steps from the middle of the boardwalk. The parking was also very close. The large shared balcony was very nice.They did have coffee in the tiny lobby every morning. Overall - it was OK.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME all around!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amber D
Reviews.Content: The Beach Walk hotel was recommended by a co-worker. We will definitely be returning and recommending to others. The service when checking in was great and all the other people staying there were very friendly as well. It appears to be very family oriented and returning people who stay there year to year. The parking lot has moved to the corner adjacent. There also remains parking on the street too. Unfortunately, we had a death in the family and had to return home shortly after arriving on our vacation. They were very compassionate and refunded our money for the time we would not be staying. Everyone was friendly, not a lot of noise, and as I first stated we will for sure be back.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: carapm
Reviews.Content: We only went down to ocean city for one night and wanted to stay close to the boardwalk..This was very close to the boardwalk and beach..The hotel is in great condition. The only complaint is that our room had a small shower and the water pressure wasn't very good. I would stay there again. I also think that they have apartment rooms so I'm sure that would be more spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccably clean and great A.C. during a heat wave”
Reviews.Author: JeanineLynn
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here in late July - Aug. 2010. Loved the location to the Boardwalk, and the ocean views from the shared porch with charming rocking chairs. We were on the highest floor - 3rd level, I believe. The room for the two of us was large, two queen beds, a bathroom with shower (no tub) and a dinette table and small kitchen area. Impeccably shiny clean. White bedspreads and crisp white sheets and beige berber carpeting with a window a.c. unit that kept us very comfortable in midst of 105 heat index days. They have an outdoor shower too, which I love and require while at the beach. There is no dedicated parking lot, so you must seek parking nearby, but we never had a problem finding parking. You can park in front when checking in and out though. The Management likes to keep the place quiet and serene, so we would sneak up the stairs late at night! Our sneaky skills are good, so no problems there. Hahaha!

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel - Too bad they can't move it to Ocean City NEW JERSEY!!!”
Reviews.Author: savytraveler722
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely wonderful. I stay in July '10 and it was our first trip to Ocean City MD being from Jersey, of course I have always frequented those shores. But I was told that OC MD is really fun and way cheaper! Well it is.... cheaper. The hotel is great but the city is a bit rowdy for my taste. I never felt unsafe or anything, but if any one is familiar with jersey shores its more like the center of Wildwood than Ocean City NJ. With that said if you are vacationing in OC MD and are looking for a quiet CLEAN hotel than Beach Walk is your place. Is it steps to the beach and boardwalk, right at the end of the ramp. You can see the ocean from the front pourches, very nice! The rooms are extremely clean, which is very important to me. They are not very fancy, but don't look bad at all, nice, organized and modern. They are on the smaller side, but not too small. I shared a room with me, my husband, and 6 month old and it was comfortable. This is a family location, but not for partying teenagers. They owners do not want that, and never do I! We had a pleasant stay and no problems. The owners, are very nice people. Some have written that they are gruff, but I found the opposite to be sure. Very nice, and personable. If you have problems with them, you probably were the problem. I can see that the wife could be mistaken as curt, but that's my type of woman, you have to be to run a hotel that nicely. The only down side is the parking. Although free, several blocks away. But my husband and I are in our late twenties and early thirties, so the walk did not bother us and we even had a 6 month old and stroller in toe! I could see that for some older people it might be a pain though, so consider that. All in all a great stay! What a nice hotel - too bad they can't move it to Ocean City New Jersey!!

Reviews.Title: “Great to be back at the beach”
Reviews.Author: cherryrmt
Reviews.Content: Excellent....haven't been to OC in 14 years and we chose an excellent place to stay....I wanted to be close to the boardwalk and Beach Walk was perfect....I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even better customer service”
Reviews.Author: Bawlmore
Reviews.Content: One of the reviews above mentions that the lady was rude. I cannot disagree more. Let me tell you what happened on a recent trip. We booked a single night and when we got there, it turned out that the hotel was overbooked, and an error was made in our reservation date. But then, the lady that runs the place made several calls, and when we walked to the rather more expensive hotel across from this one, and got a room, she paid the difference!!! In cash! Including taxes. Unbelievable. The fact is that she probably did not owe us that courtesy. And, she could have found a place that is at the same price point. But yet, she apologized profusely, and paid the hotel bill. The hotel itself looked clean, and is located splendidly. This is my spot in Ocean City in future.

Reviews.Title: “The owner/operator is very rute and impatient”
Reviews.Author: oceancityvac92010
Reviews.Content: The owner was rude to my husband when we made the reservation over the phone and he said he said she stopped in the middle of conversation with him to say something to one of her employees that sounded demeaning and very rude.ut the rooms and parking etc. He later called back about to ask some general questions about the hotel and the same lady answered and was just as rude before. We were almost not going to show but the location was perfect (right off of tenth street) . When we arrived however the parking was across the interstate and 3 blocks down. What a pain in the butt. If it wasnt for the cleanliness. We would have left and found another place. Would not recomend due to parking and the rudeness of hotel staff

Reviews.Title: “Another great visit”
Reviews.Author: 5PATravelers5
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the Beach Walk. The first time was five years ago and we really enjoyed our stay then. We tried to book the Beach Walk every time we visited OC but most of our trips were last minute so the hotel was already booked. The location is fabulous; the second house right off the boardwalk on 10th street! The beach is huge so there is no problem getting a good spot on the beach – just go early if you prefer to be closest to the water. Everything we did was in walking distance for us. Although we could have utilized the tram on the boardwalk or the bus that takes you up and down OC for $2/day. The hotel itself is older and looks like a classic beach house to me. Nice porches with rocking chairs to lounge on and watch the ocean or people walking by. The owners due a fantastic job of keeping the unruly people away. We were on the third floor and there is no elevator but this was not an issue for us. Our room consisted of two-queen beds (one was in its own separate room, no outside access) mini fridge, microwave, two dressers, two TV’s, nightstands, and two AC window units. There were no actual seats in the room. Space was fine for the three of us on vacation (all adults). The bathroom consisted of a shower stall (the ladies had some trouble shaving their legs) a toilet and sink. The bathroom size was adequate for us. The only issue we had was the towel rack was missing – we assumed it was broken but unfortunately never replaced, as there was a space for it on the wall. The bathroom did not have its own AC window unit so the door had to be kept open to keep it cool. Beds were fine but a bit softer then we all preferred. The room was clean and probably painted in the off-season. There was very little décor but we weren’t there to stare at the walls of a hotel room! There were two outdoor showers as well. I used one of them twice while we stayed there. Water pressure and temperature were both fine. However, since the showers never really had any direct sunlight, I could see moldy spots in the shower. Parking for the hotel was across Baltimore Ave and Philadelphia Ave and up to 12th street. So it was nice walk to get the car but then again we never really needed it due to the location of the hotel. If you are lucky, there is some free parking right outside of the hotel, but they fill up fast! The hotel also had coffee available in the morning and offered free use of beach umbrellas! For our trip, this hotel was again perfect. Comfortable, great location and very affordable! We will definitely be back! I would recommend this hotel for anyone who likes to get out and enjoy the sites and sounds of OC. However, if you like to just lounge in your hotel room, this place probably should not be your first choice, but surely a consideration.

Reviews.Title: “it was quiet and nice but small...you are almost right on the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: jus29
Reviews.Content: i will start with the things i didnt like.i have back problems and carrying the luggage up 3 flights of stairs was not fun.our room was really small but it was right by the door to go out to the porch.it did not have a bathtub and with a 2yr old that was not good.it stated they had flat screen tv but in our room it was a older model and it was not a flat screen.parking is the big big thing you have to park 2 streets away but you can sneak a spot up by the hotel where you can park free but you cant move from that spot or it will get taken.the things i did really like.it was a great view of the beach...you mise well be right on the boardwalk.location was great.it was nice a quiet and very friendly people that stayed there.the owners were very nice people.the room was very modern and updated and clean.they offered free umbrellas which was great for our kid and us.free coffe that was nice too.anything i asked for they were very quick to respond....yes i would stay again but i like staying somewhere different evry year but in years to come i would go back,it was a nice stay.price was great! ! !thank you

Reviews.Title: “Clean,friendly,safe,wonderful atmosphere, excellent for small family vacations!”
Reviews.Author: trh818
Reviews.Content: July 2010, spent another 10 days at beachwalk with my family. Could not ask for more. Learning which rooms are best for your accomidations is your best bet. There are always room for familys where they can be comfortable and safe. Owners are always on site and willing to give aid to whoever needs it. Much work has been put into making everyone"s stay comfortable, clean ,affordable and most of all friendly I can only hope that this review will assist many in their reservation decisions. God Bless....Try it out, you wont regret it. And your only steps away from the beach, with beachview from all porches.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: oc12398
Reviews.Content: It was definatly cheeper than many other places which showed somewhat in the quality of the room. The room was clean but was a smaller one than the room in the photos. The bathroom was the smallest bathroom I have ever seen. Apperently, it was a closet and got converted into a shower and toilet. The sink was outside of it was kind of convient because I was there for senior week with three other girls. Pretty much a good hotel and nice owners if you follow the rules. There were kids who got kicked out of the hotel while we were there. The location is perfect its on a part of the beach that isn't highly populated. Overall, a nice place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Good set-up for a family reunion”
Reviews.Author: TeresaCJ
Reviews.Content: We have spent four lovely days at the Beach Walk Hotel. This is a small family-owned and -operated hotel. The rooms are eclectic and not a full-service hotel but has everything we needed to have a great vacation with extended family. We rented 5 rooms for a family get-together. We chose Ocean City because it is between Virginia and Pennsylvania where much of the family lives, and we chose Beach Walk Hotel because of the reviews on TripAdvisor.com that the rooms are clean and a good value. This is definitely true. The hotel is on a side street, one building off of the boardwalk. We all agreed that the location is perfect because we were away from the heat and hubub of the boardwalk, but still had a very good view of the beach. We spent many hours on the porch visiting with each other between trips to the beach or boardwalk. The position of the porch is perfect to catch breezes from the ocean or bay. The rooms with 2 beds are by far more comfortable. There is plenty of space in the 2-bed rooms, with a small kitchen sink and refrigerator and small dining table with folding chairs. One of the 2-bed rooms had the beds in 2 separate rooms with a door between them. The 1-bed rooms are small but perfect for single guests or kids (we placed an air matress on the floor). Negatives are that there is no elevator, and all rooms are on the 2nd and 3rd foors (the owner lives on the 1st floor). You have to carry everything up the exterior stairs. We have a couple of people with knee problems, and they struggled with negotiating the stairs. Also, the beds could be a little more comfortable. I am accustomed to Comfort Inn or Hampton Inn beds, and these beds are firm but cheaply made, probably comparable to a Motel 6. Also, parking can be a problem. As the owner explains when you book the room, there are only a few free spots on the street in front of the hotel. Otherwise, the owner provides free parking passes for a lot 3 blocks away. Parking is at a premium everywhere around the beach (and expensive), but you can keep your car in the free parking and take the bus which is only $2 to ride all day. Beach Walk Hotel is very clean and well maintained. The cost made the trip affordable for all extended family members to participate, especially since we could bring our own food and drinks. In summary, the Beach Walk Hotel is a great value for a small family or extended family, with easy access to the beach and boardwalk to keep everyone entertained.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on the cheap, as close as you can get to the beach without being on the boardwalk.”
Reviews.Author: stephandtim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Beach Walk Hotel for a one-day causal anniversary trip. Very, very close to the boardwalk, less than 50 steps away. The room provided all that we needed. A bed, bathroom, tv , dresser and fridge. Not overly spacious, but not cramped either. The furnishings were new and everything was clean. The hotel provides free parking a few blocks away and umbrellas to use at the beach. Can see the boardwalk from the balcony. Nice rocking chairs to use as well. Staff was friendly and we had a wonderful time. Paid less than 125 bucks a night during peak season. Awesome deal and you get much more that what you pay for. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: hunter112
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, but sparse. Not even a chair to sit in. There was a TV, but it was one of those smaller flat-screens that you sometimes see, I guess I really didn't come to the beach to watch TV, though. If we hadn't been allowed to park in the Americana parking lot across the street while it's undergoing renovations, it would have been a nasty inconvenience to have to walk three blocks away across a busy street to get back and forth from the car. The porch was nice, rocking chairs were comfortable, and the breeze felt good. I was dismayed at first about not having a beach view from our room, but that soon faded when I realized what other places in the area were charging. Good thing we were there during the "off" season, or it might have seemed a bit cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally Located Very Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KimQueenofQuo
Reviews.Content: Although we arrived at 10pm the owner was there to meet us, sort out our parking for the car and help carry our suitcases to our room. Our room was a fair size with 2 double beds, wardrobe space, a table with 3 chairs, an easy chair, a TV, a fridge freezer and microwave. In the bathroom we had a bath with shower head and toilet. Soap shampoo/conditioner provided. The shower was a good power shower and there were plenty of clean towels everyday. The air con worked fine in our room and the temperature was perfect most of the time. The bed was clean fresh and comfortable. The hotel reception on the 2nd floor has a coffee machine and stuff to make tea and coffee where people tend to meet up in the mornings and sit and chat. You can also sit out on the balcony and look to the beach to your left. The reception also has tourist leaflets. We arrived on the Friday of bike week thousands of bikers in town but other than the roads being busy it made no difference. We slept well there was no noise the hotel was very quiet. The hotel is a few footsteps from the beach and the hotel has some umbrellas to use on the beach. They even found us a couple of chairs to borrow. There are plenty of food places along the Boardwalk to eat. Great location for a beach holiday with very friendly owners.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Place - Small But Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Melb33
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel a month prior to coming to Ocean City this past weekend for Sunfest. What a good choice! The hotel is very small. Room was small but exceptionally clean. The bathroom was even smaller and clean, save a small amount of mildew at the bottom of the shower curtain. I can understand why a few prior reviewers commented on the owners/managers of the hotel - we creeped up the back steps after 1:00 a.m., making a point to be very quiet as we had read the prior reviews - but still got scolded from an open window about the amount of "noise" we made. They do run a very tight ship, which is great and they were very nice at check-in, letting us in well prior to check-in time; however, we still are baffled by the scolding incident. It was, however, not enough to deter us from booking a room again should we ever return to OC, MD. Good choice for the fall months if you travel on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “A No Frills, Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Kelmo7
Reviews.Content: Very quaint hotel, close to the beach and boardwalk. Parking was very limited, however we were able to park in the free spots for most of our stay. Otherwise you have to park a couple blocks over. The first night, we stayed in the room with one queen sized bed which was way too small. We moved to the room with two double beds and felt more comfortable because there was more room to move around. The owners were nice but we really only saw them once or twice during our stay, which wasn't a big problem. I would advise people to bring an iron unless they want to share the hotel iron because there aren't any in the room. Hotel was well maintained and clean. We had a hard time getting a comfortable temperature in the room. Even thought the air blew out cold, it still seemed "stuffy" and humid in the room. Private outside showers came in handy when coming back from the beach. Use of hotel beach umbrellas also came in handy. Overall had a nice stay, would come back for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: BandE2010
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3-day getaway to Ocean City. Prior to leaving, we scoured the internet looking for a relatively inexpensive, clean, safe place to stay that was close to the ocean. We found it in The Beach Walk Hotel! The environment there is one of family-no rowdy behavior is permitted-so the hotel was super quiet. The front porches have rocking chairs so you can hang out and watch the boardwalk, etc. Our room was cleaned daily and our towels were replaced with clean ones. The only drawback to the BWH is the parking situation-the main lot is 3 blocks away. There are a few parking spots close to the hotel, but they are few and far between. Overall, however, we would highly recommed The Beach Walk Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: itstheears
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very last minute! We looked at other places, but the reviews scared us! We chose Beach Walk Hotel because of the positive reviews. We lucked out and there was availability! The room was very clean and the owner was available and very friendly for our visit! It was extremely close to the beach and boardwalk! We are going back next year because of our fantastic stay! The room was very comfortable for as much as you are in it during a trip to the beach and the price was very reasonable!! My husband and I made a great choice!! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “110% PERFECT for senior weekers, graduates, and groups of friends!”
Reviews.Author: elliottsm90
Reviews.Content: The Beach Walk Hotel is an absolutley beautiful hotel! I stayed with 3 of my friends for senior week and couldn't have been more pleased. It's PERFECT for graduates and senior weekers looking for a nice, comfortable hotel...and literally steps away from the boardwalk. Our room that we stayed in (17)... perfect size, made you feel at home, VERY clean, convient balcony, and overall pretty quiet. It also had a microwave, sink, table, a FULL fridge/freezer, tv, dressers, closet, COLD A/C, a very decent sized bathroom, COMFY queen sized beds...for everything you got with the hotel and the location... the price is EXCELLENT!...Completley worth every penny (120$ a night). There's also a security guard outside at night that makes you feel very comfortable while you're at the hotel late at night...he's nice, not a pest, just asks for your ID and you're on your way back inside the hotel...no biggie, and there is NO CURFEW which is a huge plus for any young adult or graduate that just wants to have fun and party at the beach without feeling like you have to be in at a certain time. The owner is also helpful and very friendly. DO NOT LOOK ANY WHERE ELSE TO STAY! Trust me being a graduate.. I looked on the internet for months upon months and asked tons of friends where to stay and luckily I found The Beach Walk Hotel because this place is 110% completley worth it, perfect location, decent price, and probaly the nicest, cleanest, most beautiful place that offers and encourages graduates! I will defintly be back and recommend it to anyone I know coming to Ocean City! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location,great value”
Reviews.Author: OHINVA
Reviews.Content: The room, bedsheets, and bathroom were all very clean. The owners were friendly. We were told at check-in that if we needed anything at all, don't hesitate to ask. Nice ocean view from balcony. Outdoor showers/changing rooms were very convenient to rinse sand off and change clothes before heading home. Also, free umbrellas you can borrow for the beach. You do have to cross a busy street coming back from parking lot, but it's one-way traffic and you never have to wait very long to cross. The room is small, but not too small for 2 people to move around. The bathroom is tiny and it can be difficult to maneuver around in, especially drying off after a shower. Even though the bathroom was small, this room was an excellent value for it's location and provided us with exactly what we needed- a clean, comfortable place to shower and sleep after a full day at the beach and boardwalk. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “There's no place like home!!!”
Reviews.Author: trh818
Reviews.Content: More and more each year, Beachwalk Hotel becomes more and more like home. Every year we go down to more and more renovations with the same excellent management. We are so greatful to have found this hotel and to know people that will go to any length to be of assistance to you. I strongly suggest that if you are looking for a clean, safe, family oriented enviornment, you will not regret staying at Beachwalk Hotel. Try it out you wont regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: tlee307375
Reviews.Content: If you want a relaxing time away, this is the hotel you are looking for. If you are looking to be loud and obnoxious, it's not. This is a family oriented hotel for those that enjoy the very short walk to the beach & boards and want to kick back & relax in a rocking chair on their beautiful porches with a drink, then make your reservations now. The price can not be beat and seeing how an older hotel can be transformed into something so beautiful was very impressing. The cleanliness.. was emmaculant . The outside showers for after the beach are a PLUS. We are not ones to pay for a trip and lay around in the room.. we were on the beach daily and on the bds at night. We thought the accomidations were PERFECT for the reason we were there.. relaxation & fun in the sun and on the boardwalk. The owners were so very nice and did anything for us.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet but small”
Reviews.Author: flattop
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a saty at the Beach Walk Hotel. From reading the reviews I knew what to expect for check in and the parking. When we opened the door to our room we both looked at each other and started to laugh. This is the absolute smallest hotel room we have ever stayed in. It was not much bigger then a walk in closet (room 22). However it was very clean, recently remodeled/new paint and trim work....very nice. We really didn't mind it being small since we were only going to be in it to sleep. Also for a room one building off the boardwalk at $129.00 a night on a weekend, you just can't beat the price. The owners were always on site and made it a point to say hello whenever we saw them..very nice folks. We will stay here again for a quick weekend getaway but probably not for a whole weeks stay. It would be just too small for a whole week and after the wife and I bumped into each other trying to manuver around the room, we decided this place is just for a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value, Best Location”
Reviews.Author: minx6469
Reviews.Content: Beach Walk is one of the cleanest places my husband and I have ever stayed at. It's located 1 building off the boardwalk on 10th Street and it couldn't have a better location. Even though it is so close to the action, the place is very quiet. Also, the owners are very nice and accommodating. We usually stay at the Clarion or Holiday Inn, but Beach Walk is now our preferred hotel. It is definitely a no-frills kind of place, but why would you need a fancy hotel anyway?

Reviews.Title: “A pretty hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: CT-Travler
Reviews.Content: There are some good things and some bad things about this hotel. First the good: The hotel has a great location. It is located just steps from the boardwalk. It is the second building from the boardwalk which means it doesnt face it but you can see it from the hotels front porches that feature chairs. The managment is on site. The owners ( a husband and wife - although you deal with the wife) live on site. They take up the first floor of the three story hotel so if you need something you can ask them. Then the bad: There are no elevators and so you will have to walk up stairs that are outside with your bags. The rooms and the lobby are on the 2nd and 3rd floors because the owners live on the first floor. Many of the hotels in Ocecan City and even on the boardwalk feature on site parking. This is not one of them. There is a parking lot that is located 3 blocks away (across a very busy road). Another option though is on street parking. There are some spaces in the city that you do not have to pay for and can park for days on end and are very safe which I used my entire stay. I was able to find spaces three times. Since the hotel does not face the boardwalk the side of the hotel has views of the boardwalk. The boardwalk area is very dense so there is another row of buildings between the hotel and the boardwalk so room views arent that great. Overall this hotel was pretty good....it was not that expensive. The hotel is in a great location (there is a hotel across the street and a B&B next to it) so if you can live with the little quirks its worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I believe that this hotel is just ok .. when we came to the hotel you had to call the manager on the phone then they were kindof rude.. acting like we messed up her whole day.. when we came in the room we found something really gross in the refridgerator .. not to mention the room is about the size of a closet. oh also the parking is not great .. you have to walk about 3 blocks.. the only good thing about this hotel would be that it is just off the boardwalk.. oh and if you want a better hotel stay at the sea breeze motel on 2nd st. that is the place to stay.. it has a bigger refridgerator and 2 beds for less then it is at the beach walk hotel... so that is that.. I would not stay there again..

Reviews.Title: “Beach Walk Bargain”
Reviews.Author: la_gann
Reviews.Content: The Beach Walk Hotel, 10th Street at the Ocean City boardwalk, was the nicest chance encounter we've had in many a vacation. Clean, quiet, great location, and some of the rooms even have a partial boardwalk view. It's clear that the owner takes great pride in her maintenance and service, and provides a great break from the rowdy student hangouts so prevalent in the area. A great choice for rockers - the kind who like to sit on the front porch and watch the sea... not the teenaged noise kind. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Be Vewy, Vewy Quiet....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was okay... After reading that parking was a few blocks away, I called and asked if there was on-site parking and was told yes, there is. This is not true, the parking lot is practically on the bay. Guess that's what they mean by Beach "Walk".... But.... other than a short trip up to rehoboth, my car did stay in the lot the location of the hotel is such that you really don't need your car while you're there. On the first night, we were shushed by the owners for talking in a conversational tone as we were entering the building around 9pm. I thought it was a bit rude, but what do you expect when your hotel room is $60/night? I would stay there again, the rates were cheap and the room was clean. There are definitely other places with more amenities in the area, but if you're looking for a cheap place to stay, I would recommend it. You may want to bring an extra blanket as well. There was not much in the way of bedding in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day 2004”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old son and I drove down to Ocean City during Labor Day for a 4 day stay and after a long trip I was very happy to see the hotel. My first impression was surprising, the photo on the website does not do the hotel justice. The hotel was so warm, cozy and clean and for the price we were paying, I was extremely happy. The owners greeted us and were very accomodating. The location couldn't have been better. We were right on the Boardwalk in the middle of all the action, great restaurants and shops. The hotel was extremely clean and all the guests were very cordial as well. We loved the rocking chairs as well, made us feel as though we were off on an island somewhere :)) I highly recommend the Beachwalk Hotel and look forward to returning next year. Keep up the good work, we had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very clean and wonderful location. Big room!! Would stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If all you need is a bed, shower and a cup of coffee in the morning, then this is the place for you. Our room was small and uninviting. In addition, there isn't any on-site parking available. A parking lot is available but it is several blocks away from the hotel. We were not aware of this prior to our stay or we would have stayed somewhere else. The hotel is clean and the location is convenient to the boardwalk and beach.
